utterance.speaker: DEB
utterance.content: Who ever thought walking in a circle at two miles an hour would be draining?

utterance.speaker: JEFF
utterance.content: Fresh air, exercise.

utterance.speaker: DEB
utterance.content: You know, some things do have their negative sides. Our income just got cut in half.

utterance.speaker: JEFF
utterance.content: And we get to spend twice as much time together.

utterance.speaker: DEB
utterance.content: More, if you don't leave before your lunch hour's over.

utterance.speaker: DELIVERY MAN
utterance.content: Out of my way.

utterance.speaker: DEB
utterance.content: We have a legal right to hold you up for 15 seconds. 15... 14...

utterance.speaker: DELIVERY MAN
utterance.content: One?

utterance.speaker: DELIVERY MAN
utterance.content: Just trying to do my job.

utterance.speaker: JEFF
utterance.content: Hey, relax, three more seconds and you can go.

utterance.speaker: DELIVERY MAN
utterance.content: Are you telling me what to do?

utterance.speaker: JEFF
utterance.content: It's okay. Just take a breath.

utterance.speaker: DELIVERY MAN
utterance.content: Get the hell off me.

utterance.speaker: JEFF
utterance.content: I think it's been 15.

utterance.speaker: DEB
utterance.content: You okay? Oh, my god, Jeff!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The place is a mess.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Welcome to a world without nurses. Here, you can start with these.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's not my fault, I don't use nurses.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Cuddy was looking for you, said she'd send you down here.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I know, that's why I'm here.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Because Cuddy hasn't found you yet.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She's going to look everywhere except the place she wants me to be. Hey.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I've got an aortic dissection here.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What's with the idiot?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Ah.. Fainting spell and recent history of dysgeusia. Everything tastes like lemon meringue pie. You want to take him?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No. Sir. Why do you have two lunches in front of you?

utterance.speaker: JEFF
utterance.content: Been here for two meals.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: And you're happy with that?

utterance.speaker: JEFF
utterance.content: No, I just don't see much use in complaining.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Seriously? It's a very useful tool. Complain, you make people miserable. They do what you want to make the misery go away.

utterance.speaker: DEB
utterance.content: We probably should say something. Maybe I can call one of the doctors I work with...

utterance.speaker: JEFF
utterance.content: They're doing their best. Ow!

utterance.speaker: DEB
utterance.content: What the hell?

utterance.speaker: JEFF
utterance.content: I'm sure it was an accident.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Is he Canadian?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Uh, he's a low priority...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Is that a yes?

utterance.speaker: DEB
utterance.content: He's just...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Happy. I've got to stop this before it spreads. You guys are done.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Could be a metabolic disorder, toxic exposure, carcinoma of the tongue metastasized to the brain, Epilepsy, MSâ€¦

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Or it could be the flu, and we should all be back in the ER.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: No, you're ignoring the big symptom. What if we're looking at both the flu and decent parenting?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Okay, you two are perfectly healthy. This guy wasn't pandering, he wasn't vanilla nice, he was nice without any aspiration for personal gain. I'm thinking genetic defect.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Niceness is a defect?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Three cavemen, see a stranger running towards them with a spear. One fights, one flees, one smiles and invites him over for fondue. That last guy didn't last long enough to procreate.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: And how long has the patient been... suffering?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: At least as long as his wife has known him, 11 years.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: The chances of him having an undiagnosed pathology for that long...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What are you saying? That evolution is wrong? Where do you think we are, 21st Century America?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: He's saying that statistics are true too. That the world is a bell curve, most of us fall within the standard deviation, but there are outliers. And if we believe in the existence of extreme jerkiness, which I suspect that we do... Then we also have to accept the existence of the opposite extreme.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You want it to be a symptom because then we're supposed to be jerks, which means you don't even have to try to be nice.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Okay, maybe I'm biased, let's take a vote. Who thinks that niceness is not a symptom? And who thinks that their vote counts? You two check out his home for toxins. Taub and Thirty-One...

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Thirty-One?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh, I'm sorry, I thought that either way was good with you. Taub and Thirteen, MRI for tumors and EEG for nerve damage. Test whatever comes out of him for everything else.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Too much axis tilt. Don't release until your thumb's at the bottom of the ball. I assume Wilson was busy.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Again.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: No axis tilt. With Amber?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Again.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Still, it was nice of you to invite me, this is fun.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No, it wasn't. No, it isn't. I didn't invite you to be nice, I invited you because bowling isn't one of the two things guys do by themselves.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: What's the second thing?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Other hand.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Well if people are incapable of being nice, why bother having the word?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Ah, the ontological proof of niceness. The existence of the word proves the existence of the concept. Look out for those minotaurs on your drive home.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I thought motives didn't matter, only results mattered. So what are you going to do to screw up Wilson's relationship so you don't have to listen to me while you bowl?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I wish the best for them and their tragically deformed children.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Well, she's good... At being bad. You might not be able to destroy her.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well as long as I give it my best shot, I can hold my head high.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Cameron had this one insufferable friend. She wasn't going to get rid of her and I sure wasn't going to join them, so I just said, see her on Thursday's. I know it's not as exciting as an exploding birthday cake, but, hell, I don't want to hang out with her every night anyway.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: That's amazing. Cameron only has one insufferable friend?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Joint custody.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Of Wilson?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Unless we have another love child?

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Deal with him.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He needs a mother figure. I'm not saying you're not entitled to spend time with him, I'm just saying I'm entitled too.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I don't know how to deal with him when he's being reasonable.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: This is reasonable? This is crazy. You're not a child, you can make your own plans.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: No, crazy is what House would normally do in this situation... Swap your lubricant with superglue.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The man knows me.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: This is his way of accepting us.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's actually a very touching moment. I'm proposing I get every other day and every other weekend.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: I have yoga Wednesday's, you can have him then. But you have to have him home by 11. We can swap weekends.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Mondays and Wednesdays, and midnight.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: If he's not home till midnight, we won't be asleep till almost 2:00.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Wilson? Make a ruling.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Uh no. You two are like dogs circling each other in the park. And I say that with all the love in the world. You need to sniff each other's butts, bare your teeth, and arrive at some strange detente. Otherwise, you'll end up biting each other's eyes out. Again, with all the love in the world.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'll let you sniff first.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Take my deal, or get out of my apartment.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Take my deal, or I move in.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: This guy worked for habitat for humanity in Costa Rica.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: And coaches handicapped kids. You think we should do a workup on the other coaches?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: It is possible he's too perfect.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: I'm not saying he's perfect, I'm saying he's trying to be. That's what people do. What?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: That's not what people do.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: People usually suck, but they want to be good, want to be nice.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: House?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Exception that proves the rule.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: What sort of argument is that?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: A bad one.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: That might be relevant. Hydrofluoric acid. Lowers his calcium, causes the fainting and taste issue.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: But not the niceness.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Wouldn't that be nice?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You are King Solomon. If you want us to cut him in half, we're cool with that.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: My boyfriend's too much of a wuss to make the call for himself... And I mean that with all the love in the world.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I'm gonna piss off one of them, and they both scare me.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Your treatment of patients is reprehensible.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You're reading his performance review?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I'm busy. We have a nurses' strike! Your management of employees borders on abuse.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Let's go.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: No, I... I want to hear it.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You are overtly contemptuous of hospital hierarchy.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: And covertly. But I suppose you didn't know about that.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Your attitude towards supervisory personnel is disrespectful, and a disturbingly large proportion of your comments are racist or sexist.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: That top makes you look like an Afghani prostitute... Would be an example of that.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Sign this.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: House, I got the...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It can wait. I will sign, if you will give us a ruling.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I will give you a ruling, if you do the reviews on your team.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'd be happy to continue the mockery of this process.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: What'd you offer him?

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Wednesday's till 11:00 and alternate weekends.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Wednesday's till 11:00 and alternate weekends.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes. Wednesday nights are ladies' nights at Cheetah's.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Calcium's normal.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Wow. It really could wait.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Everything's normal.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: And you thought it wouldn't be.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: He's a carpet cleaner, he's got a home full of hydrofluoric acid.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Doesn't mean his calcium should be low.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Yeah, actually it kinda does, HF causes lower levels of...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: LowER, not low.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Lower than normal.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Lower than yesterday. Yesterday might have been high, what's lower than high?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: He actually has hypercalcemia, which is being lowered to normal by the HF.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: So what gives us elevated calcium, bad taste, and fainting?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: I take it you know?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Get the team. This is going to be fun.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Hello, again. These people think you are not too nice.

utterance.speaker: JEFF
utterance.content: Too nice? For what?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: For life as we know it to have evolved without an intelligent designer. I'm going to prove them wrong. Your wife... is very ugly.

utterance.speaker: DEB
utterance.content: Get out of here.

utterance.speaker: JEFF
utterance.content: Deb. He's obviously trying to prove a point.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I think I just did. You're either perfect or you're sick. In my experience sick is much more common.

utterance.speaker: DEB
utterance.content: He's not sick, he's nice.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Nice in the sense that your toaster is nice for making you breakfast. It's the only thing his wiring will let him do. He has William's syndrome. Your husband is missing the genes that make him suspicious.

utterance.speaker: DEB
utterance.content: You're wrong, he'sâ€¦

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Relax, there's no cure. He's going to go right on tasting lemon meringue pie, fainting, and being a sap.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: What about the other symptoms?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He has no other symptoms.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: But William's does.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He's got the teeth, glasses.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: William's cuts IQ by 20...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He doesn't work in the physics department. Except when they spill a black hole on their carpet.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Elfin appearance?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yeah, he's more legolas than Keebler, but I bet you he can still crack off a batch of Pecan Sandies.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Perfect pitch?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You love to karaoke, right?

utterance.speaker: JEFF
utterance.content: I suck.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Modest, another symptom...

utterance.speaker: DEB
utterance.content: No, he really does suck.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Give us a warble. You know any Cher?

utterance.speaker: JEFF
utterance.content: No, but I know bread. Baby I'm a want you, baby I'm a need you, you're the only one I care enough to heard about...

utterance.speaker: DEB
utterance.content: What's the matter?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: He's stroking.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Not a moment too soon.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: You were wrong.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Why do people say that with such pleasure? It's very hurtful, you know?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: It means the patient gets to keep being nice. Why does that offend you?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's the way he said it. He wasn't relieved, he was excited. He was also wrong, and I say that with no sense of pleasure.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Patient tested negative for William's, which means the stroke and everything else wasn't caused by...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You. Have a friendly demeanor, but you sometimes get too involved. You relate well to your peers and patients and you complete tasks in a timely manner. Please sign.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: What the hell was that?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I have to give each of you performance reviews. Plenty of other conditions can cause debilitating niceness.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: How is that supposed to help him?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I don't know. How's it supposed to help Wilson? Cross out Wilson's name and the date, and then fill in your own...

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: The point of a review is to give feedback to help...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm thinking neurosyphilis. Wouldn't show up on the MRI without contrast.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: I'll go run the tests.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: He doesn't think it's syphilis, but he's going to go run those tests anyway.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Because he doesn't know. That's why we do tests.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Because he's a wimp, because he's afraid of you.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You want me to intimidate him into not being afraid? Not sure I know how to do that.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Reviews make a difference. People have to listen, so they have to learn.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I don't think that the right time to tell the dog not to pee on the rug is semi-annually.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You don't want to do the paperwork.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I am concerned about the rainforest.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I'll do it.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: JEFF
utterance.content: I don't have syphilis.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: You don't know.

utterance.speaker: JEFF
utterance.content: How many ways are there to get it?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: You can know who you had sex with. You can't know who she...

utterance.speaker: JEFF
utterance.content: I do.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Not for sure.

utterance.speaker: JEFF
utterance.content: It's a waste of time. I had a stroke, you can't keep wasting time. We were tested for the Peace Corps.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Ten years ago. You haven't been with your wife every minute of every day.

utterance.speaker: JEFF
utterance.content: You think I'm naive, don't you?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: I think you're... Yeah.

utterance.speaker: JEFF
utterance.content: I know my wife.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: She's not perfect.

utterance.speaker: JEFF
utterance.content: I'm not perfect. But she loves me, and she's always loved me. Every minute, every day.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You're 15 minutes late!

utterance.speaker: GUY
utterance.content: Have you heard the good news?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Miley Cyrus is playing a third night at the spectrum?

utterance.speaker: GUY
utterance.content: Happiness is possible. And not just in this life, but in the next...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh, you're selling religion. I'm sorry, I bought some Islam yesterday.

utterance.speaker: GUY
utterance.content: Well, it's where your light shows signs before mending... Have a good evening.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You're late.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: 15 minutes.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: 16 minutes, MY 16 minutes.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: So keep him an extra 16 minutes.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You hear that? She doesn't care.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: You're going mini golfing, what's it matter? You got a tee off time?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It matters because you don't get to decide what matters.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: It was my fault, I had to take a shower.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Which was my fault.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I had to take a dump. Anything else I don't need to know before you leave?

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Have fun on your play date. You've got mummy's numbers, right?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Daddy needs a drink.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: I was thinking, if we discount the niceness issue...

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Sit down.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: I think it's a heart defect.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Nothing on the echo.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Could be a Patent Foramen Ovale. It explains the stroke, and the syncope, and a PFO wouldn't show up on a routine echo. I'm gonna do a bubble test.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You got a minute first?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I think you've shown remarkable strength in a difficult situation.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Are you giving me a performance review?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: A good one.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: I'm gonna do a bubble test.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: There was enough blood left over from his admission work up to run the VDRL.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You doubted your patient.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: No, what I thought didn't matter. House said he wouldn't let us go on until we ruled out neurosyphilis.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: It's not neurosyphilis, it's a PFO.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: It's neurosyphilis. The tests were positive.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: It's always the same conversation. They tell you, you must be mistaken, which is why I always run the tests twice, and then they blame the other guy. Which makes sense if they're innocent, but obviously, half of them aren't. They don't seem to get that they're busted. Scientifically proven.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Unless your spouse cheated too.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Exactly. That's what you're praying for in that moment. That she cheated too. And then if she doesn't kill you, you know that she did, you know she betrayed you. And then, you realise that that sucks worse.

utterance.speaker: JEFF
utterance.content: The test must be wrong.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: I ran it twice.

utterance.speaker: JEFF
utterance.content: Not that test, the one I took ten years ago. What other explanation is there?

utterance.speaker: DEB
utterance.content: He really sees no other possibility.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Did you have an affair?

utterance.speaker: DEB
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Then why aren't you angry with him?

utterance.speaker: DEB
utterance.content: You ever know anybody who's just too nice?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: DEB
utterance.content: It's annoying. Then you realise it's annoying because they remind you of what you are not. That you'll never be as good as they are. And then you think, why can't I? And before you know it, that naive idiot you laughed at has made you a better person. You really think I've been in love all these years with a symptom?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: If syphilis caused lesions in his brain, and the lesions caused personality changes, you may notice a change in him as his condition improves.

utterance.speaker: DEB
utterance.content: I know my husband. He's not going to change.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: You should get yourself tested.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: So much for the bell curve. How can House be an ass without it being an illness, but niceness is a biological crime?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: You got five bucks?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Uh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Niceness just cost you five bucks. Being an ass generally turns a profit.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Kutner, could you excuse us? I need to do Taub's review.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: You can stay.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I think it would be better if this was done privately.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: This isn't going to be done.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: What is it with you guys? I've given you advice before.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Not as our boss.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: What's the difference? Advice is advice.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Fair enough, I'll go first. You demonstrate a great air of confidence, which is really pissing me off.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: House authorized me...

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: How long have you known him? He's using you.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I volunteered because I knew he wouldn't...

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: He could care less about the paperwork. He's using you to screw with you. He knows it'll annoy us, we'll stand up to you, which will force you to confront the fact that even though you think you're our superior, you're no different from us. He gave you authority to keep you in your place.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: It's true.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Not him, what'd he say?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Nothing, what's true?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: If there's something wrong with this guy, it means there's something wrong with House.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Are you trying to get me drunk? What time is it?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Ooh... She'll kill you.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'll get you home before lights out.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Great, then she'll kill me. If I get, if I get any more drunk, then I'm... It... Might not work. If you, uh, know what I mean.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Really? You'd think that one or more of your ex wives would have mentioned that to me.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: They told you? Wait, why do you want to get Amber angry?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Because I'm your friend.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: No, no, no. You said you approved, you said you were taking the high road. For how long, the first exit?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Hello, and thank you for saving me from being righteoused to death.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Patient's vomiting blood.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Hematemesis could indicate...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Don't put it on the board.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: You don't think it's a symptom?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I think it's my marker. He has syph, and what?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: And syph, it can cause hematemesis.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Not everyone agrees.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: How... How could you...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: If you all thought it was syph, you wouldn't have woken me up in the middle of the night.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: If it was just syph, he wouldn't be getting worse, he's already on penicillin.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: The bleeding's probably from liver damage, probably caused by ethanol in the cleansers or the penicillin.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Two more probablys than I like to hear.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Liver tests and serologies are going to take a full day.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Full night, actually. Guy might not make it to brunch. Yes, I knew about your issue with alcohol. Yes, I intentionally got you drunk to provoke an argument between you and Amber. Why I would do such a thing is an interesting question. What's more interesting is that you knew as much as I did and you're the one who's pouring down the drinks. Why?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Because I thought I was out having fun with a friend. I didn't know the drinks had subtext. I got to get home.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: GGT's normal, rules out alcohol.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: How about serum protein?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: It's positive.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Kind of assumed he HAD protein. It's how much protein he has we care about.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: It's positive for syphilis.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: You mind if I give you a performance review?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Not the patient. House. He has syphilis.

utterance.speaker: FEMALE SOAP CHARACTER
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: MALE SOAP CHARACTER
utterance.content: Every time I searched my soul... I found Anna.

utterance.speaker: FEMALE SOAP CHARACTER
utterance.content: Are you going to tell Marie?

utterance.speaker: MALE SOAP CHARACTER
utterance.content: I have to.

utterance.speaker: FEMALE SOAP CHARACTER
utterance.content: It will destroy her.

utterance.speaker: MALE SOAP CHARACTER
utterance.content: Could it be any worse on her than loving somebody who can't love them back?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: You might want to turn off the TV.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm multi-tasking. Also doing my taxes. And Cuddy. What'd you find out?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: The patient has hepatitis.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I assume from your omission of the word 'viral' before the hep that it's not another STD. Put him on steroids and test him for sarcoid before the liver failure becomes liver failed.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: We're all doing this.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: There's more?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You have syphilis.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No, I don't.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: One of us found a vial of your blood in the lab...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Which one of you?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: It's treatable.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: We filled a prescription.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: So this is why he is who he is?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: We don't know.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We know. It's not just a coincidence.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Wilson says he's always been a jerk.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: But he got worse.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: After his leg.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: The leg was a coincidence.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Did you sleep with him?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: So what's going to happen? What's going to change?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Maybe he'll be less of a jerk.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Or less of a doctor.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: You got to be a jerk to be a good doctor?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I don't know, maybe House does.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Why aren't you answering me?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Because it's none of their business. It's none of your business.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I think the STD makes it my business.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Humans are complicated.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Humans are simple.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: A million different things make us who we are, you change one, you change everything. If Mozart was better adjusted, decides to play catch one day, maybe there's no magic flute.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You did, didn't you?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: There's something I need to tell you.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: You returned him drunk.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: On time.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Drunk.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: On time. No tag backs.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: The purpose of the time was to give me time.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: So you didn't have sex?

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: I like sex.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well you can have it tonight. The L Word is on.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: You don't get to decide what matters. Either you're genuinely afraid I'm going to make him miserable, or you're afraid I'm going to make him happy, or you simply can't stop screwing with anything that moves. It doesn't really matter, because whatever the reason, you'll only get worse. Until either I stop seeing Wilson, or I stop you. What do you think I'm going to choose?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: If you terminate the agreement, it's not going to bring peace in the mideast.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: I'm not terminating the agreement. I'm amending the agreement. I'm adding penalty clauses.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Fine. Whoever violates it gets their finger cut off.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: I'm serious.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: So am I. You want people to drive safer, take out the airbags and attach a machete pointing at their neck. No one will drive over three miles per hour.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: I'm not cutting...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: We'll figure it out. On your time. You know she's certifiable right? I've got the forms in my desk.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Where is she wrong? What were you going to tell me?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You're punishing me?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I needed to tell you something... privately.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I'm not going to tell her.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You'll tell her. She's your girlfriend, you should tell her.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You're my friend.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's not the same.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Don't sulk.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Where am I wrong?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Your management style is counterproductive. You gave me authority over the team, just so they could undercut...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Critiquing the clap addled? That's sort of tasteless.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I didn't feel like waiting until your genitals cleared up. You need to formalise my authority over the team.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No, I don't.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You don't think I'm qualified?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Compared to those three?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You want to punish Cuddy for hiring me without...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I like Cuddy. I like parts of her.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You want to crush the team by crushing me?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I want to empower them. Those three idiots need to respect you. They should respect you, they should be afraid of you, so I have to humiliate you, because if the team fears you, they won't question you. If they don't question you, they won't get any answers, if they don't get any answers, they're useless.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Mocking me saves lives?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The hospital will probably build you a statue one day. You know, with a 'kick me' sign on the back. So when you think about it, the more I mock you, the more it shows I have respect for you.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Or you made up that BS because you like humiliating me.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Wouldn't rule that out completely.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: You busy?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Almost done. Uh, so just remember, the rabbit goes around the tree and jumps down the hole.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Negative for sarcoidosis.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Run him for everything you can think of. Lepto, schisto, hemo, and the fourth Marx brother nobody ever heard of.

utterance.speaker: JEFF
utterance.content: You bitch!

utterance.speaker: DEB
utterance.content: I just went to get us some lunch, you were asleep.

utterance.speaker: JEFF
utterance.content: You moved my book.

utterance.speaker: DEB
utterance.content: Jeff, calm down. It's just the drugs.

utterance.speaker: JEFF
utterance.content: The drugs didn't move my book...

utterance.speaker: DEB
utterance.content: Jeff? My husband's having a heart attack. Can somebody help me please? Somebody help me, please!

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: She saved his life.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Or she scabbed. Depends on your point of view. So what do we think? New symptom? Or just a wife beater? Hey, time for you to take this baby for a spin.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: We, uh, loaded him full of prednisone to try to fix the liver.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Good news is, he's running out of organs to fail.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Prednisone could cause Roid rage, which could cause hypertension, which results...

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Roid rage after six hours?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: At that rate, by sundown, he'll have eaten most of us.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Uh, it still could be penicillin, allergic reaction.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: How does a fried liver put him into a rage?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: It's not frying his liver, it's frying his syphilis. The penicillin's working, the real patient is emerging.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: So... syphilis prevents domestic violence. I'm going to be even more attractive to the ladies.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: I was going to test for a heart issue before the syphilis. PFO could explain the heart attack and reduced blood flow to the brain could explain the rage.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, they're all good ideas. Okay, let's take a vote. How many think it's the roids talking? And who's for the penicillin? And how about whatever she said? Someone hasn't raised their hand.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Whatever I decide? You're setting me up.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Why would I do that?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: PFO.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The PFO's have it. I just hope the bubble test is positive or it's no more Mr. Nice Guy.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: We gave Van Gogh chelation therapy. Turned him into a house painter.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Maybe not, maybe we just put Hitler on Ritalin.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Are you comparing House to Hitler?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Oh god.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Just because I don't think he's Hitler doesn't mean I slept with him. I don't sleep with everyone who's better than Hitler.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Maybe Taub is right, maybe this is good.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: This is not good.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Well, he respected our opinions, he mocked himself, he was civil, he shared.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: He didn't care.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: He never cares.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: He didn't vote. He always cared about one thing, solving the puzzle but he was irrelevant to that diagnosis. He had no opinion of his own. He now cares about nothing.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You had no choice, you had to treat him. What's done is done.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You know that thing I was going to tell you, I've got to tell you. I've got to tell someone. You have to swear not to tell CB.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Whatever.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, that's not swearing, that's shrugging. It's actually the opposite of swearing.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I won't tell Amber.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: My team thinks that I have syphilis.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Do you?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Not yet.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Why do they think you do?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Because I knew that they had access to an old blood sample, and I knew they'd test it sometime for something.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Why would you swap your blood? What are you afraid they'll find?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Shut up, you're missing the point. Now, they think that I'm on penicillin.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Is this some clever practical joke that I'm not aware of?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: And as I get better, I get nicer.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: That's brilliant.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Foreman thinks I actually value his opinion. Thank god he said PFO, or I'd have had to do some dancing. You got time for bowling? Come on, it's work hours.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I'll get my shoes. So we don't need to talk about...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: So you're going to keep screwing...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yeah, and you're going to keep talking about it. We are who we are.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I'll get my shoes.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Okay, got a good view of the heart.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: What if we lower House's dosage? Maybe stabilise him, he doesn't get worse, he doesn't get better.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Quite the line to walk, if we're wrong he dies of neurosyphilis.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: If we don't, other people die.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Other people who aren't our boss.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: People.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: This sucks, the guy had a gift. I'd kill... Hi, what...

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: House doesn't have syphilis, he switched the blood samples.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: How do you know that?

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: House told Wilson, I wanted to ruin House's day. See ya.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: We're idiots.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: We're not idiots, positive blood test means positive blood test.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Apparently not. There they are, let's see if they... Uh, what are you doing? We're not done.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: He doesn't have syphilis.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Patient tested positive for syphilis, right?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Is this some sort of recap?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: But why did he test positive for syphilis?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh! Uh... I know this.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Either one, he has syphilis...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I was going to say that.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Or two, the test was wrong twice, or three, he gave us someone else's blood.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Amber.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Get that idiotic smile out of my face. I've got to go on a killing spree.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Or, four, he has something that tests positive for syphilis.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's not chagas.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: He worked in Costa Rica before he was married.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Is two a spree, or do I have to kill you too? Chagas wouldn't explain the niceness.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: I've heard of remote tribes that actually practice acts of kindness, or the chagas caused encephalitis.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The MRI showed no signs...

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Until we started him on steroids, compromised the immune system and let the infection flare up. I did another one. It's not much.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's plenty. You figured this out because I don't have syphilis? Damn. That should have been my epiphany.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Good news, bad news. Good news is we know what you have, it's treatable, you're going to live.

utterance.speaker: JEFF
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: DEB
utterance.content: What's the bad news?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The cure is a grueling course of pills. It's like one a day for a month.

utterance.speaker: JEFF
utterance.content: Now you're just trying to make me laugh.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yeah, like that's a challenge.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: You have chagas disease. It's a parasite, it's been asymptomatic for ten years.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well not quite. Your brain's been swollen, not enough to see but enough to alter your personality.

utterance.speaker: DEB
utterance.content: Now we're back to that.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He screamed at you, you don't think he can change?

utterance.speaker: DEB
utterance.content: That was because of the drugs.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: So you think drugs are more powerful than parasites? I mean... The ones we're going to give you to treat the parasites obviously are but... I stand by the principle.

utterance.speaker: DEB
utterance.content: I'm not worried.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Neither am I.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Neither am I, but that's because I don't care.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Reviews?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It was brought to my attention that on occasion, I am not respectful of hospital hierarchy.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: The word was "contemptuous." Well phrased, thoughtful. Identically phrased. These are all the same.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Because, underneath it all, we are all the same. And Foreman refused to type his up.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Well, it's more than I expected.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: There's an extra one in there.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Your treatment of patients is non-existent because you're not a doctor, you're an administrator.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Foreman convinced me that these can be helpful.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Your management of employees is, well, let's face it, they're outside carrying signs. The strike ended, the nurses have been back for two shifts already.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You'd think I'd have noticed. What exactly did they do around here? You act like employees should fear and respect you, but your eyes tell us... Actually your eyes tell us nothing because we're looking at your boobs. Which tell us that you're desperate to have someone jump on you and tell you they love you one grunted syllable at a time. What you want, you run away from. What you need, you don't have a clue. What you've accomplished makes you proud, but you're still miserable. Please sign.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I got a call from Amber today. Says there's been a violation of your contract. You've been seeing Wilson on her time.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She breached confidentiality. You can let it slide, officer. We're even.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Yes, you are. You're both losing fingers.

utterance.speaker: DEB
utterance.content: Look what I found.

utterance.speaker: JEFF
utterance.content: Nice.

utterance.speaker: DEB
utterance.content: They think you might be able to come home tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: JEFF
utterance.content: Oh, yeah? That's good.

utterance.speaker: DEB
utterance.content: What's the matter?

utterance.speaker: JEFF
utterance.content: The ketchup. There's something wrong with that.

utterance.speaker: DEB
utterance.content: Tastes fine. Is anything else?

utterance.speaker: JEFF
utterance.content: Everything else is great. I just... I don't know. I guess I don't like ketchup anymore. Wonder what else I don't like.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Roll over.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: We need a tougher punishment.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Want to come over to the poopy side? Where are you two going Friday night?

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Dinner at L'auberge.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You're lying.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Of course I am.
